attributes.action: End junk mail paper waste via Royal Mail
attributes.additional_details:
Royal Mail is making an estimated £184m a year by putting nearly 3 billion junk leaflets in the post.The Mail Preference Service, used by 6.5 million people a year, lets households opt out of receiving addressed junk letters, it does not stop junk mail. This is despite unaddressed mail accounting for around a third of all UK mail, according to Citizens Advice. 
The climate disaster is being fuelled by greed at our expense, if there was a ban on junk mail, it would negate the need to recycle it.
attributes.background: How many trees have to be cut down to fill the demand for the millions of junk leaflets put through every door each week? Around 12-16 trees are required for a tonne of junk mail production, this means that with an average of 550,000 tonnes sent out each year in the UK, over 7.7m trees are wasted!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because ending the Royal Mail leaflet distribution service would be a decision for Royal Mail and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You might want to sign this petition calling for a ban on junk mail instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/249527
